page.section:
To the right worshipfull my verie loving frend M
r
Thomas Bodley esquio
r
employed for her Ma
tie
in the
Cou
ncell of State in
e Lowe Contries.

From S
r
Frauncis Walsingham dated the 2 of August
1589
page.lettertext:
Belgia 1589 2 Au
g
To M
r
Bodly
M
r
Bodley
S
r
At the earnest sollicitation of the
States
some
forces
are sent from hence, and some other shalbe spared out of
the Cautionarie Townes and the Townes of
Ostende
and
Berghen
to make head against the enemie, and
S
r
Francis Vere
as Sergeant Majo
r
apointed
to have
e charge of them, which I thought fitt to give
you knowledge of, to thend you should not be unacquain-
ted w
th
anie thing that may concerne those Contries.
For
e matters of
Fraunce
we here nothing since the
Last dispatch unto you,
and therfore w
th
my hartie
c
o
mendations I c
o
mend you to god. From
e Court
at Nonsuch this second of August
1589
.
Yo
r
verie Loving frend Francis Walsyngham
The deputyes desyre to be
lycensed to departe, w
ch
we
fynde here verry straynge
consydering we have not yet
receyved from them any
awntswer whether the states
wyll according to her Ma
ts
request amplyfye
her commyssyon or send some other well qualefyed
persons to joyne w
t
them furnished w
t
a [newe]
[large] comyssyon then they have. They growe
verry prowde w
ch
makethe us here to suspect
some [wrong] measure at their hands. Your
Letter towching the two dowbtes I had, hath greatly
satysfyed me. Yt may be that the alteratyon
now lately happened by the murther of the
late
K
wyll make them [.] [.] & uppon
a newe hope
t
waye
standyng as they doe greatly
assured to the new
K
. I wyshe that owre fortune
and [.] were not so straytely tyed as yt is: so
as we can not well untye w
th
out great hasard
and then there woold be easely fownde
some waye to free us fr
o
hon
r
w
t
owt perryll
